title: So. Many. Scarecrows. Gatlinburg, Tennessee, seeks Guinness World Record with 4,325 of them
text:
CLOSE Gatlinburg is attempting to break Guinness World Record for largest scarecrow display in one location Brianna Paciorka, USA TODAY NETWORK – Tennessee

GATLINBURG, Tenn. — Scarecrows have taken over downtown Gatlinburg.

The Gatlinburg Convention and Visitors Bureau is attempting to break the Guinness World Record for the World's Largest Display of Scarecrows, and Monday morning, bureau officials counted the scarecrows throughout the town, according to the Knoxville News Sentinel, which is part of the USA TODAY Network.

The previous record of 3,812 scarecrows is held by National Forest Adventure Farm in the United Kingdom, according to the Guinness World Record website. Three counters from the Gatlinburg Convention and Visitors Bureau added up 4,325 scarecrows and announced the total Monday morning.

The number is enough to break the record, but Gatlinburg will have to wait six to eight weeks until they hear from Guinness to see if they hit all the marks, according to Chad Netherland, director of marketing and public relations for the bureau.

The World's Largest Display of Scarecrows record parameters include surpassing the number of 3,812 scarecrows, all of the scarecrows having human facial features and all of them being in the walkable area of downtown Gatlinburg, according to Cheryl Wilkins, director of events for the bureau.

How the Tennessee city prepared for the Guinness record

Gatlinburg ramped up its fall decorations a few years ago, according to Netherland, and officials realized last year they could attempt to break a world record with local scarecrows.

Netherland said businesses and the community got involved in attempting to break the record this year. The Gatlinburg Convention and Visitors Bureau bought thousands of scarecrows for the downtown area, and business owners and residents also bought and made their own to contribute.

"It's good to see involvement from all the business communities" he said. "They all participated, and it looks beautiful."

Decorating for the record attempt started around two weeks ago with most of the scarecrows going up in the last week.

The scarecrows and fall displays will stay up through the end of October, and then Gatlinburg will switch them out for holiday decorations, according to Netherland.

Guinness World Record process

Scarecrows on display in front of Ripley's Aquarium of the Smokies in Gatlinburg, Tennessee, on Oct. 14, 2019. Gatlinburg is attempting to break a Guinness World Record for the largest display of scarecrows in one location. (Photo: Brianna Paciorka/News Sentinel )

The official count for the world record attempt started at 7:30 a.m. Monday. The counters traveled with a videographer on a golf cart to count the scarecrows throughout the town.

For the world record submission to Guinness, they had to have multiple witnesses, touch and count every scarecrow and film the count continuously, according to Netherland.

"There's all kinds of official rules, and we have followed these to the T, so we are excited, but it is a Guinness record, and they hold their rules and they hold their standards at the highest level, so we are excited to see where we come in with this," said Netherland.

The bureau sent the video and affidavits to Guinness World Records on Monday and will wait for official word
